title: Director, Geographic Communications
description:
Director, Geographic Communications. New York. Posting Date: 09/27/2024. Deadline: 10/17/2024
Role Title
Director, Geographic Communications
Grade Level
Level F, Grade 13
Reporting To
Senior Director, Communications
Program/Tool/ Department/Unit Name
Communications
Team Name
Geographic Communications
Role Purpose
The Director has expertise in external and crisis communications and reputation management, including current controversies/issues and leading figures/thinking. The role requires extensive knowledge and experience of cross-cultural leadership along with knowledge of international and geographic variations in practice. The Director is responsible for maintaining and strengthening the institutional, programmatic, and financial integrity of OSF in addition to their geographic divisions of external and crisis communications.
The role includes significant coaching of colleagues and managing cross-department, cross-program, or similarly complex global and geographic projects in a manner that encourages clear communication and respectful colleagueship, in a supervisory capacity. Relationships are critical and diverse, requiring the development and nurturing of trust within internal and external fields across cultures and geographies in which competing interests, complex political and cultural factors, and tensions between long- and short-term goals must all be managed effectively. This role reports to the senior director of Communications with three associate directors of geographic communications reporting to them.
Key Responsibilities* The Director leads geographic teams, coordinating communications strategies across these teams to advance our priorities and shape a positive view of the Open Society Foundations, its founder, leadership, and grantees.
* Manages top tier international and geographic media focused on telling the story of the Open Society Foundations
* Improves the public identity of the network and ensures that our global narrative and messaging cut across all of our geographic work, when appropriate
* Leads on our efforts to combat misinformation, disinformation, and attacks on the Open Society Foundations
* Advises on crisis communications plans and leads staff in developing geographic strategies to address emerging crisis situations
* Guides pitching of op-eds based on extensive knowledge of media landscape; and
* Writes and edits content for internal and external audiences


People Responsibilities (Total Team/DRs)
Yes (3 direct reports, total team 8)
Key internal relationships
ELT; Communications SMT; Communications; Geographic and Opportunities Directors
Key external relationships
Top tier press contacts, public relations directors; foundation peers
Qualifications
Essential:* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field of study or equivalent


Experience
Essential:* Extensive, progressively responsible experience in roles relevant to the duties of the position
* Prior experience in managing staff and large programs is highly desirable
* Experience in an advisory role to senior management, including president/CEO level


Desirable:* Experience in philanthropic communities and media


Competencies
Functional Competencies:* Significant field experience including budget management, people and team management, and project management
* Expertise in their field of specialization, including familiarity with current controversies/issues and leading figures/thinking, as well as substantial knowledge of principles and practices in organizational management and cross-cultural leadership
* Ability to exercise creative leadership in projects and programs of substance and expertise in creating new and innovative approaches to improving a programmatic team, area, and/or unit


Desirable:* In-depth knowledge of all major areas of interest within Open Society and the key relationships and interests associated with them


WalkMe
Personal Competencies:* The Director will also have a strong understanding of cultural differences.
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English are essential.
* The Director will leverage key relationships within the field and within the organization in order to further programmatic goals.
* Demonstrates commitment to OSF’s core values of humility, commitment, collaboration, respect, inclusivity and integrity.


Languages:
An excellent knowledge of English. Knowledge of other languages would be an asset.
The salary range for this role in the US is $145,100 - $275,700. The final offer is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set and level of experience. *Competitive rates of pay apply.**Open Society Foundations is committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion, and to building a diverse staff that reflects the movements, issues and communities that our mission serves. Candidates from all underrepresented backgrounds, identities and communities are encouraged to apply.**We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and colleagues with disabilities.*
company_description: The Open Society Foundations work to build vibrant, tolerant societies whose governments are accountable to the participation of all people.

title: Spring 2025 FOX News Media Internship Program - Graphic Design - New York
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox News Media
FOX News Media operates the FOX News Channel (FNC), FOX Business Network (FBN), FOX News Digital, FOX News Audio, FOX News Books, the direct-to-consumer digital streaming services FOX Nation and FOX News International and the newly announced platform FOX Weather. Currently the number one network in all of cable, FNC has also been the most watched television news channel for 20 consecutive years, while FBN currently ranks among the top business channels on cable. Owned by FOX Corporation, FOX News Media reaches 200 million people each month.
JOB DESCRIPTION
FOX is proud to support a culture of creativity, entrepreneurial spirit, and community that attracts the industry’s brightest talent. The FOX Internship Program is for motivated college students who are passionate about the news and media industry. Students are paid to gain real-world work experience with guidance from top media professionals. Students are assigned to a department that matches their skill set, work experience, and career aspirations.
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS:* Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree during the length of the program
* Current class standing of sophomore, (second-year college student) or above
* Strong academic record
* Committed and available to work for the entire length of the program
* Access to own housing and transportation to/from the assigned internship site for on-site opportunities
* Must be able to work on-site in New York


STUDENTS SELECTED TO MOVE FORWARD IN THE INTERVIEW PROCESS:* Must demonstrate knowledge of company and media industry


TO APPLY:* Submit a 1-page resume (PDF preferred)
* Submit a cover letter (PDF Preferred)
* Submit a link to your portfolio
* Explain why your background and experience make you a good fit for our program
* Share your top areas of interest


STUDENTS ACCEPTED INTO THE SPRING 2025 PROGRAM:* Are required to provide a copy of an unofficial transcript or letter from adviser/registrar showing proof of enrollment


SPRING 2025 SCHEDULE:
General Application Deadline: Sunday, November 24, 2024
Program Timeline: Monday, February 10, 2025 - Friday, April 18, 2025
Scheduled Weekly Hours: 16 - 24 hours per week
NOTE: Schedules vary based on department needs and your availability. We do our best to work around your class schedule.
STANDING OUT AS A TOP CANDIDATE:
As a Graphic Design intern, you will learn the workflow for producing creative and visually compelling graphics to support daily editorial content.
Successful students have:* Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and some knowledge of After Effects
* Strong understanding of design principles, layout, typography, and color theory
* Knowledge of current design trends in graphic design and typography
* Knowledge of the company, current events, and news/entertainment/sports/media industry
* Strong written & verbal communication skills
* Strong understanding of current events on a national scale
* The ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
* The ability to work well on teams and collaborative efforts
* A self-starter attitude and proactive nature
* Comfortability in asking questions and following directions
* Strong attention to detail


PROGRAM FEATURES:
FOX Master Classes: A variety of presentations, panels, discussions, and trainings geared toward advancing your knowledge of our company, industry, and software systems
Professional Development Series: A variety of activities geared toward enhancing your professional development
Networking Opportunities: Numerous opportunities to connect with fellow interns and other professionals within the company
#EntryLevel #EarlyCareer*We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.**At FOX, we foster a culture and environment where everyone feels welcome and can thrive. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and different perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen. That means reflecting the diversity of the world around us is critical to our company’s success. We ensure that our viewers, communities and employees feel heard, represented, and celebrated both on screen and off.*  


Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience, and location is: $17.50-17.50 per hour.

1211 Avenue of the Americas
New York, NY 10036

title: Spring 2025 FOX Entertainment Internship Program - New York
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
FOX Entertainment
With a legacy spanning more than 35 years, FOX Entertainment is one of the world’s most recognizable media brands and a prolific content producer across its iconic broadcast network and both owned and third-party streaming platforms. Known for its independent, innovative spirit and provocative, groundbreaking storytelling, the company was reinvented in 2019 with the formation of FOX Entertainment. While maintaining its leadership in broadcast television (9-1-1: Lone Star, The Simpsons, The Cleaning Lady, Hell’s Kitchen, LEGO Masters), the company is actively building a portfolio of businesses and library of owned original content. To date, FOX Entertainment’s long-term growth strategy has included the acquisitions of award-winning animation studio Bento Box Entertainment (Bob’s Burgers, The Great North, Krapopolis, Grimsburg), entertainment platform TMZ, and global production studio MarVista Entertainment (The Way Home, Rescuing Christmas), as well as the formation of the culinary and lifestyle content venture Studio Ramsay Global (Next Level Chef, Gordon Ramsay’s Food Stars) in partnership with Gordon Ramsay. The company also established its in-house unscripted studio FOX Alternative Entertainment (The Masked Singer, Snake Oil, I Can See Your Voice, Name That Tune), FOX Entertainment Studios (Animal Control) to develop scripted content, and worldwide content sales unit FOX Entertainment Global.
JOB DESCRIPTION
FOX is proud to support a culture of creativity, entrepreneurial spirit and community that attracts the industry’s brightest talent. The FOX Internship Program offers an exciting opportunity for you to gain practical experience while interning for one of the biggest sports, media, and entertainment companies in the world. You will be considered for an internship based on the content of your cover letter, as well as your prior experience and interests, as determined during the recruitment process. Area of placement may include (but are not limited to):* Experiences and Design
* Publicity
* Research


SPRING 2025 SCHEDULE:
General Application Deadline: Sunday, November 24, 2024
Program Timeline: Monday, February 10, 2025 - Friday, April 18, 2025
Scheduled Weekly Hours: 16 - 24 hours per week
NOTE: Schedules vary based on department needs and your availability. We do our best to work around your class schedule.
STANDING OUT AS A TOP CANDIDATE:
Successful students have:* Knowledge of current FOX Entertainment programming and talent

Our Technical Operations team offers an unique experience for our interns. Working with the Technical Operations team will expose you to our Control Room/Studio Operations, as well as Transmission, Lighting and Editing.
You will be exposed to our prompter systems and software. Our interns will gain exposure to facets of studio operations including teleprompter, studio setup, and other studio positions.

Currently the number one network in all of cable, FNC has also been the most watched television news channel for 20 consecutive years, while FBN currently ranks among the top business channels on cable. Owned by FOX Corporation, FOX News Media reaches 200 million people each month.

FOX is proud to support a culture of creativity, entrepreneurial spirit and community that attracts the industry’s brightest talent. title: Cake Decorator for an ice cream parlor
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Bonus based on performance
* Employee discounts
* Flexible schedule
* Free food & snacks
* Opportunity for advancement

  

This job is for Cold Stone Creamery located in Morganville, NJ. We are professional, customer-centric, fast-paced and our goal is to deliver the Ultimate Ice Cream Experience. The secret recipe for smooth and creamy ice cream is handcrafted fresh daily in each store, and then customized by combining a variety of mix-ins on the frozen granite stone. Cold Stone Core Values - Do the right thing - Be the Best Be #1 - Bring out the BEST in our people - Profit by making people happy - Win as a team.  

  

Our work environment includes:  

  

* Growth opportunities
* **Flexible** working hours
* On-the-job training
* Company perks
* Safe work environment
* Lively atmosphere

**Benefits/Perks**  

  

* Flexible Scheduling that ranges from weekdays to weekends between 7 AM and 11 PM
* Competitive Compensation
* Career Advancement Opportunities
* Free ice cream every time you work and discount on products you want to take home
* Substantial amount of tips

**Job Summary**  

  

We are seeking an experienced **Cake Decorator,** with **flexible** **hour** to join our team!  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

  

* Build and decorate Cold Stone Creamery's Signature cakes, Theme cakes.
* Build and decorate custom cakes as per customer request (including photo cakes)
* Build and decorate novelties like cupcakes, cookie sandwiches etc.
* Maintaining adequate levels of cakes and novelties that ready for pickup
* Follow recipes and guidelines for cake production and decoration
* Maintaining a clean store, and keep cake decorating supplies organized.

**Qualifications:**  

  

* Previous cake decorating experience a must. Food service experience would be a plus
* Familiarity POS software
* Ability to remain calm and thrive under pressure
* Strong communication and problem-solving skills

title: Cable Installation Tech
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Opportunity for advancement
* Training & development

  

**Job Summary**  

We are a small business based out of Baltimore, MD **(we cover the following areas Baltimore, city , Baltimore Co., Anne Arundel Co with opportunities to travel out of state )** seeking **Installation Technicians** to join our team! As a Installation Technician, you will be installing Comcast cable services which include telephone , internet, cable boxes and wire , as well as security services. You will be repairing and or upgrading existing services and or equipment, which can include cable wires in or outside the home . You will also be troubleshooting systems that are having trouble, running diagnostic tests, ordering replacement components, and ensuring every system you touch is working properly. The ideal candidate has cable experience , excellent communication skills, and enjoys problem-solving complex issues but this is not a requirement as we provide on the job training. We provide work vehicles, uniform shirt and a set of cable tools. You will be required to purchase steel toe boots, and khaki colored cargo pants. You must be able to carry and use a 12 foot ladder, you will be provided with safety equipment such as harness and hard hats. You must be prepared to work a 12-hour shift during your working schedule. You must also prepare to work a fluctuating schedule. You must be prepared to drive during your working shift to complete jobs. You must be able to work well with a team. The pay can be discussed in more detail during the phone interview, but we are paid by the job , so you will be provided with your pay scale so you are able to calculate your pay check and we pay on a weekly schedule. **LOOKING FOR TECHS THAT ARE WILLING TO TRAVEL( AREAS:MD/VA/PA/MA/ATL.ANY FUTURE ACQURED AREAS).** **TRAVEL TECHS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR INCENTIVES (EX. DAILY OR WEEKLY STIPEND/INCREASED PAY RATE/INCREASED WORK FLOW/PAID HOTEL STAY, ANY OF THESE INCENTIVES COULD BE OFFERED)**
  

  

**Responsibilities**
  

* Install new equipment for customers (cable, phone, internet, security systems and monitors, cable wires)
* Troubleshoot existing equipment that isn’t working, run diagnostic tests, and fix any problems that arise
* Upgrade outdated equipment
* Walk the customer through any new or updated equipment to ensure everyone knows how to use it properly
* Maintain a clean and safe working environment by always wearing proper PPE and following safety procedures
* following placed procedures and meeting internal goals

**Qualifications**  

* Excellent customer service skills
* Previous experience with cable equipment desired
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
* Must be comfortable working on your feet, in tight spaces, and a variety of weather conditions
* Must be able to pass background and urinalysis
* must have a valid drivers license
* must have iPhone (needed to complete jobs and the cable systems only work on IOS)

title: Bartender
description:
**Benefits/Perks**  

* Flexible Scheduling
* Competitive Compensation
* Career Advancement Opportunities

**Job Summary**  

We are seeking a **Bartender** to join our team! In this role, you will be responsible for taking customer orders, making drink recommendations, keeping the bar area clean and inviting, and creating a variety of traditional and creative cocktails. The ideal candidate is energetic, customer-service oriented, and is passionate about mixology.  

  

**Responsibilities**
  

* Take drink orders
* Confirm patrons are of legal drinking age and follow all state and federal laws for serving alcoholic beverages
* Collect payment and operate cash register
* Order, maintain, and restock inventory of bar supplies and ingredients
* Perform duties associated with opening and closing the bar, including cleaning and mopping

**Qualifications**  

* High school diploma/GED
* Previous experience in food service, hospitality, or bartending is preferred
* Mixology or hospitality certification is preferred but not required
* Knowledge of alcoholic beverages and bar menu items
* Legal age to serve alcoholic beverages
* Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent customer service and time management skills
* Ability to work well in a team environment

title: Busser
description:
**Benefits/Perks**  

* Flexible Scheduling

  

**Job Summary**  

We are seeking a **Busser** to join our team! In this role, you will remove dirty dishes and wipe down surfaces, replace tablecloths, set tables, and provide patrons with water and coffee. Your goal is to ensure an exceptional dining experience for our patrons. The ideal candidate is friendly, service-oriented, and works well in a fast-paced environment.  

  

**Responsibilities**
  

* Wipe down tables, chairs, and other surfaces
* Remove tablecloths and reset tables
* Remove dirty dishes, glasses, and silverware from tables
* Perform other duties as assigned
* Refill coffee, water, and condiments as needed

**Qualifications**  

* Previous experience in hospitality or food service is preferred
* Familiarity with food safety guidelines
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to stand for long periods and lift up to 30 pounds
* Friendly and outgoing personality

title: Bid Manager & Business Development Specialist
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k) matching
* Bonus based on performance
* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Free uniforms
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off

  

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Bid Manager to join our dynamic team. The Bid Manager will be responsible for overseeing the end-to-end bid process, from initial opportunity identification through to contract award. This role requires strong project management skills, excellent communication abilities, and a strategic approach to securing new business opportunities.  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

* Manage the entire bid process, including coordinating with cross-functional teams (Sales, Marketing, Operations, Legal) to develop winning proposals.
* Identify new business opportunities and tenders aligned with the company's strategic objectives.
* Review bid documents, contracts, and customer requirements to ensure compliance and responsiveness.
* Develop bid strategies and value propositions tailored to each opportunity.
* Conduct research and analysis to understand client needs and market trends.
* Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop compelling technical and commercial content for proposals.
* Lead bid review meetings, providing guidance and feedback to team members.
* Ensure timely submission of high-quality proposals that reflect the company's strengths and capabilities.
* Maintain a repository of bid materials, templates, and best practices for future reference.
* Track bid outcomes and participate in debriefs to identify areas for improvement.


  

**Qualifications and Skills:**  

  

* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* Proven experience in bid management, proposal development, or a similar role within a competitive industry.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet tight deadlines.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
* Strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail and a results-oriented mindset.
* Proficiency in MS Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and experience with bid management software (e.g., Qorus, Ariba, or similar).
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience in government contracting or B2B sales is a plus.


  

**Benefits:**  

  

* Strong Bonus structure based on performance and project outcomes...
* Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
* Health insurance participation
* Simple IRA / 401K retirement plan with employer matching.
* Generous paid time off (PTO) and company holidays.
* Positive work environment fostering collaboration, innovation, and professional growth.

title: Business/Medical Office Manager
description:
Job Description:  

  

  

As the Business Manager at Turner Dermatology, you will oversee a wide range of responsibilities critical to the success and growth of our practice. You will be responsible for managing human resources, marketing efforts, and billing processes to ensure the smooth operation of our business.  

  

  

Responsibilities:  

* Manage the hiring process, including creating job descriptions, posting job openings, reviewing resumes, conducting interviews, and selecting the best candidates.
* Oversee the onboarding process and create an employee guide to ensure the success of new employees.
* Ensure employees are knowledgeable about company policies, procedures, systems, and organizational culture.
* Manage on-site internship programs aimed at developing medical assistants.
* Work closely with the billing team to track outstanding payments and resolve any discrepancies efficiently.
* Monitor prices and adjust to inflation and cost of goods.
* Track revenue and expenses and identify areas for improvement to ensure long-term success.
* Monitor and manage practice finances, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
* Implement cost-saving initiatives and revenue-generating strategies.
* Oversee day-to-day operations to ensure efficiency and effectiveness.
* Identify and implement process improvements to streamline workflows.
* Coordinate with other teams related to Turner Dermatology to ensure smooth coordination and communication.
* Implement training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge.
* Conduct performance evaluations and provide feedback for continuous improvement.
* Foster a positive work environment that encourages teamwork and collaboration.
  


  

Qualifications:  

* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, or related field
* Proven experience in human resources management, marketing, and billing processes within a healthcare setting.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.

Detail-oriented and proactive approach to problem-solving.  
* 

  

Benefits:  

* Employee discounts
* Paid time off

Professional development opportunities  
* 

Application Process:  

  

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your qualifications and experience for this position.

title: Batteries Plus Sales Associate
description:
**Title:** Sales Associate  

**Reports To:** Store Manager  

**Effective Date:** 5/2024  

**Exemption Status:** Non-Exempt  

  

  

**General Function**  

Provide device repair technician support to store, utilizing technical problem solving skills, electronic cross-reference, and web research. Repair cell phones, tablets, light fixtures, and other devices. Provide customers total solutions to their battery, bulb, and services problems while doing so in a courteous, professional and helpful manner.  

  

**Essential Responsibilities**  

**Device Repair / Technical**  

* Repair cell phones, tablets, and other devices based on priority
* Replace screens, batteries, and other components on smartphones and tablets
* Able to rebuild cordless drill batteries and other battery packs as needed
* Replace cords, sockets and other parts on lamps and light fixtures
* Assist with cycle count every week to reflect the accurate utilization of device repair inventory
* Rotate and stock inventory
* Follow all safety rules and regulations; wear proper Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
* Cut keys and reprogram key fob remotes

  

**Customer Service / Sales**  

* Greet customers, determine needs and answer questions
* Suggest sell add-on items
* Directly communicates with customers about device repairs and status of repairs.
* Maintains problem resolution proficiency standards and customer satisfaction levels. Escalates situations to management when necessary
* Ask questions to identify potential commercial customers
* Operate computer/cash register to complete sales transactions with accuracy
* Watch for loss prevention issues and advise management of any unusual activities
* Demonstrate a customer-first mentality

  

**Other Duties**  

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  

  

**Qualifications**  

* High School education or equivalent required with relevant experience strongly preferred. Associates degree in electronics, or other technical degree preferred.
* 3-6 months of previous device repair experience. Demonstrated technical aptitude.
* Demonstrated problem solving skills. Duties require the ability of the use of judgment in minor decisions and use of some judgment as to the method of performance.
* Excellent organizational skills. Ability to work with relative independence on regular, routine duties, referring questionable situations to supervisor or others.
* Good listening and verbal communication skills with a customer focus; general knowledge of customer service policies/procedures
* Demonstrated attention to detail and ability to effectively manage and track multiple commitments; effectively prioritize, follow up, and meet deadlines.

  

**Physical Requirements / Work Environment**  

*The physical demands required to perform the essential responsibilities of this position are as follows. Reasonable accommodations, if necessary and/or as required by law, will be made available.*  

* This position requires the employee to regularly use hands to handle or touch electronic products, stand, walk, sit, frequently talk and hear; occasionally stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, and reach above shoulders. Lifting 10-20# on a regular and frequent basis, 50# on an occasional basis, and more than 50# on an infrequent basis.
* While performing the responsibilities of this position, the employee will occasionally be exposed to fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, outdoor weather conditions and the risk of electrical shock. The level of noise in the working environment is moderate.
* The position also requires the employee to regularly use electrical cables, simple hand tools, a magnifying glass, spot welders, automotive and electronic testing equipment, key cutting and programming equipment and a company automobile.
* Protective clothing and/or equipment used in this position includes safety glasses, goggles, gloves, and steel-toed shoes.

  

**Affirmative Action / EEO Statement**  

It is the policy of Batteries Plus to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.  

  

  

**Benefits/Perks**  

* Competitive wages
* Career Growth Opportunities
* Fun and Energetic Environment
* Ongoing training
* Employee Discount

title: Billing Administrator / Practice Manager/ OON Therapy Practice
description:
We are looking for an organized and experienced **Physical Therapy Billing Administrator / Practice Manager** to join our team  

  

The Medical Biller / Practice Manager will support the therapists while being responsible for managing patient and insurance information, support and collaborate with Front office Receptionist / Administrative Assistant, and initiating payment processes and procedures. The ideal candidate will be well-versed in billing software, medical insurance regulations, and an expert at responding to patient and insurance inquiries. The medical biller will also be responsible for maintaining patient confidentiality, handling personal information, and providing **world class customer service** to all clients.  

  

**Medical Biller / Practice Manager Duties and Responsibilities**  

  

* Complete Revenue Cycle Management for OON OT/PT Therapy Practice
* Ensure patient information is accurate and complete
* Request any missing patient information
* Review referrals and authorizations
* Confirm patient benefits and insurance
* Follow all regulations and guidelines set by Medicare, state programs, and commercial insurances
* Review insurance claims and billing data in billing software (Web PT and Therabill)
* Create both paper and electronic copies of documentation
* Develop and maintain a tracking system of incoming and late payments
* Monitor and date late payments
* Initiate late payment notices to relevant parties
* Respond to questions and complaints from patients or insurance companies
* Follow-up on late or missed payment notices
* Monitor and resolve financial discrepancies
* Arrange payment plans and timelines for payments
* File and maintain organized documentation of all billing and record
* Follow set billing processes and procedures
* Update and review all accounts to keep records of payments up-to-date
* Work with personal information and maintain patient confidentiality
* Collaborate and support Front Office Receptionist / Administrative Assistant
* Provide concierge quality service to all clients throughout their course of treatment

**Medical Biller / Practice Manager Requirements and Qualifications**  

  

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, health care administration, finance, business, or related field preferred
* Two (2) years’ previous experience as a medical biller or in a related healthcare administrative position with certificate.
* Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
* Self-motivated and self-directed; able to work without supervision
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Proficient computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel); working knowledge of billing software a plus
* Strong customer service skills and comfortable answering both patient and insurance company questions
* Able to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions
* Experience with supervision and/or collaboration of administrative front office staff
* Desire to join a growing company
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Ability to represent the practice and therapists with outgoing personality
* Desire to support the growth and success of our therapy practice

**About Us**  

  

We are a boutique therapy practice in Union Square, NYC, specializing in Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Hand Therapy and Wellness programs.  

  

To apply please email resume and include the subject "Experienced Billing Administrator" along with your salary requirements. Explain why you would be a good fit for our company, and why you are qualified to move to the next phase of interviews.  

  

Job Type: Full-time  

  

Salary: $55000 - $65,000.00 per year  

  

Experience:  

  

* OON Medical Billing: 2 years (Preferred)
* OON Therapy Billing Experience
* Complete Revenue Cycle Management

Education:  

  

* Bachelor's (Preferred)


License:  

  

* Medical Billing and Coding (Preferred)


Language:  

  

* English (Required)

title: Boating Operations Assistant Manager
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k) matching
* Bonus based on performance
* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance
* Free uniforms
* Health insurance
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off
* Training & development
* Vision insurance

  

We are seeking an Boating Operations Assistant Manager in Lake Hopatcong to help oversee our Operations Department.  

  

During the ‘boating season’ you will be helping to guide daily activities of a team supporting boating club members, boat rental guests and slip customers. You will be involved in team development, guest relations, fleet care, and supporting other departments in the marina such as Sales and Service. In the ‘off-season’ you will support fleet decommission and recommission, improve marina systems and strategies, minor maintenance projects and efforts, and guest development efforts. This is a dynamic position integral in creating happy boaters. We provide you leadership, training, coaching, and great experiences.  

  

The Boating Operations Assistant Manager works in partnership with the Operation Manager and the entire Bridge Marina team to lead the delivery of Boating Club, Boat Rentals, Dock Slips, Gas Dock, Marine Store and Property(s) Management.  

  

This role allows you to enjoy the outdoors, working with boats on the water, helping friendly people are happy to see you. The work efforts change with the season keeping work interesting and exciting. The boating seasons are lively, and the off seasons are traditional. This is a great role to advance and learn the boating industry and supporting skills, as well as an opportunity to advance in the field with us.  

  

Our team is welcoming, engaged, caring and respectable and we are seeking new teammates who fit in this culture. You will receive significant support, as well as training in marine systems, boat handling skills, customer service, and numerous other skills to operate in the marine environment. Working in a marina, and Bridge Marina, is unlike other roles you may have had. You will have access to fun perks like 'staff events on the water', other boating opportunities, as well as rewarding times on and around the water working with a great team.  

  

Some responsibilities are:  

  

* Provide care and support to guests and teammates to ensure they are having safe, fun, and rewarding experience.
* Assists with seasonal, monthly, weekly, and daily care, safety, and administration for fleet of boats and marina facilities, its’ gear, and storage.
* Assist with direction and completion of general marina operational tasks, maintenance projects, and seasonal schedules to ensure the marina, fleet, and offices are effective, safe, and clean.
* Perform various season projects to improve systems, strategies, and the facility for subsequent seasons.
* Assist and oversee boat preparation including cleaning, system checks, safety, launching, hauling, and moving.
* Assists in the training and development of teammates match required culture of marina. Support training and performance of Operations Team to create a fast, friendly, safe service.
* Assist with scheduling and direct daily activities and assign specific duties.
* Communicate with guests to remain aware of current and future guest needs and to recommend additional services.

Some skills and characteristics for this role are:  

  

* An interest working on and around the water.
* Good communication skills: interest and ability to clearly understand guest and team members needs as well as effectively communicating your directives and expectations.
* Ability and interest to be friendly, diplomatic, and polite with guests and team.
* Outgoing, positive, and supportive outlook, maturity, a strong work ethic, and enjoyment of helping others.
* Organization, managing projects and schedules.
* Management skills; responsible and accountable for self and for those you lead.
* Proactive planner and problem-solving skills.
* Familiarity with up to 25-foot single engine boats, familiar with boating rules and regulations.
* Boating Safety Certificate and 3 years boating experience
* Basic mechanical awareness and reasoning.
* Responsibility of working independently as well as on a team and as a leader.
* Patience, empathy, determination, self-awareness, optimism.

Bridge Marina core competencies are the defining skills and capabilities that give Bridge Marina advantages over our competitors. With our focus on highest level of guest satisfaction with every experience, as a teammate you will be expected to have knowledge and skill in each core competency and apply great understanding to each activity undertaken.  

* Workplace Safety: Understands the risks that come with the environment and takes the proper and proactive steps necessary to ensure safety.
* Guest Focus: Appreciates our guests, their situations, perceptions, desires and expectations and attends to their needs in effort to build enduring relationships with the highest level of satisfaction.
* Personal Leadership: Takes responsibility for actions, behaviors, and commitments. Seeks to expand own capabilities and strength. Develops and utilizes positive leadership traits to guide the direction of own efforts.
* Dependability: The quality of being trustworthy and reliable.
* Initiative: The ability to assess issues and initiate effective solutions independently.

Requirements  

  

* Customer service experience
* Leadership or managerial experience; maturely leading or overseeing others.
* Valid clean automobile driver’s license.
* NJ Boating certificate and boating experience.
* Good health and great physical mobility
* Ability to pass a pre-employment background/drug screen.
* Work indoors and out in various weather conditions.
* Schedule: Jan-April schedule Tues-Sat. May-Sept any day of week. Oct-Dec Tue-Sat.

This position is a full-time year-round position with opportunity for advancement and growth. We provide health care benefits, retirement plan with company contribution, paid vacation, paid sick time, team events, and opportunity for additional rewards and perks such as boating access, winter holiday breaks, and more. Scheduling is 5-days a week Tues-Saturday from October through April *and* includes Sundays from May through September. Compensation is commensurate with experience. Salary range is $45,000-$55,000 per year plus gratuities and incentives.  

  

P.S. Experience on and around boats is terrific and will allow you easier learning curve and faster advancement, although, extensive boating experience is not always required as we have trained many teammates newer to boating who are now essential parts of our team. If this specific position does not suit you - but our culture, industry and business do - please continue to send application including an indication of your area of interest or ability.  

  

*Bridge Marina does more than just boats; it’s a place where people come to learn to boat, to get on the water and to enjoy all the fun, entertainment and exploration boating can offer. We seek teammates who would enjoy working on and around the water, working with boats and boaters, and being around fun and energizing people. Each team member at Bridge Marina brings skills and passion to a fun, challenging and ever-changing environment on the water.*  

  

*Bridge Marina inspires boaters of all abilities to get on the water. You can feel the energy and enthusiasm when you step onto our docks on a sunny summer afternoon. We have a team of diverse hospitality focused people who provide boat service, boat sales, boating club, boat training, boat rentals, slip services and more in Lake Hopatcong and Sandy Hook New Jersey. Our team and company provides one of the most unique and inspiring boating experiences in the industry.*  

  

Learn more about us online at www.bridgemarina.com or on Facebook, Instagram or TikTok @brigemarina. We look forward to connecting with you.

title: Calibration Technician/Repair
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Bonus based on performance
* Training & development
  

  

  

**Summary** : This is a full time position reporting to the SR Tech. Duties entail instrument repair, instrument calibrations, product setup, quality control checks, service and customer support. Support will include, maintenance, troubleshooting, system monitoring, and installation support of material testing instruments and machines. The successful candidate will be a young, highly detailed oriented individual, in good physical shape, with ability to lift and move equipment as needed. Tech program graduate a plus. Related experience essential.  

**Essential duties and responsibilities:**  

Repair work:  

Instrument repair on small, handheld, pcb based instrumentation, and repair of benchtop testing machines, both mechanical and digital systems. Mechanical and electrical aptitude necessary. Highly disciplined, detail oriented and meticulous work ethic mandatory. Full Working knowledge of hand tools, basic connection soldering experience expected. Maintain and document repair logs. Assist with parts procurement.  

QC check/Product setup:  

Each machine gets checked for quality issues and set up properly before shipping to customers. Will follow Quality Control procedures, calibrate and test using NIST standards. Maintain and generate documentation.  

Tech Support/Customer Support:  

This will include customer contact by phone and/or video conference for the purposes of troubleshooting , providing tech support and installation support. Will diagnose and isolate equipment and system malfunctions, leading to solutions.  

**Requirements** :  

* Solid Mechanical aptitude a must
* 2-5 years related work experience
* Knowledge of connection soldering
* Knowledge of the operation and uses of basic electronic test equipment
* Knowledge of basic mechanics
* Ability to analyze and solve problems
* Good computer skills, Microsoft office….
* Good written and oral communication skills
* Good interpersonal skills – working well with others
* Quality of work – highly disciplined and detail oriented work demands the same type of worker
* Pass background check

**Physical Requirements** :  

  

* Sit or Stand for extended periods of time
* Able to lift/carry equipment if needed
* Perform maintenance related activities

Job Type: Full-time  

  

Salary: $40,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year  

  

Benefits:  

  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching

  

Schedule:  

  

* Monday to Friday


Supplemental pay types:  

  

* Bonus pay


Work Location: In person

title: Bookkeeper/Account Specialist
description:
RISE Architecture is an architecture firm with projects in the 5 boroughs. We are based in Industry City, Brooklyn, an innovative area with creative building spaces and many amenities. We are looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated and an extraordinary Account Receivable Specialist to join our team!  

  

We offer an excellent learning environment and opportunity to grow.  

  

**Job Description**  

  

Must be proficient in QuickBooks with **3 to 5 years** of experience in the same field.  

  

Your work responsibilities will be:  

  

* Working with QuickBooks
* Manage activities including protocols, policy, and procedure development.
* Creating journal entries such as entering invoice information and recording banking transactions in the bookkeeping database
* Creating Invoices, sending them to clients, and follow up on the collection of funds, and confirming due dates for payment with Clients.
* Following up on a weekly basis with consulting staff and ensure that their expenses have been successfully recorded.
* Oversee private pay collections and ensure appropriate steps are being taken
* Evaluating and analyzing reports and data to inform management of problematic trends.
* Using trackers in excel to keep count of project status and pending invoices.
* Responsible for oversight of month end closing and bank reconciliation.
* Saving invoices and receipts both in binder filing and online/cloud-based

Responsible to operate payroll and record timesheets for all the staff.  
* 

You will work directly with the CEO and the Manager. You will also have the opportunity to learn and perform other back-office related operations ranging from general administration, phone calls and HR.  

  

If this is the perfect job for you, please send your resume in **PDF** format.  

  

Job Type: Full-time  

Monthly MetroCard or equivalent if you drive  

Simple IRA plan  

  

Experience:  

* Quickbooks: 3 years (Required)

Accounts Receivable: 2 years (Required)  
* 

Work authorization:  

* United States (Required)

title: Store Manager
description:
**Are You Craving A Career With An Industry Leader?**


Panda Express is searching for experienced leaders to join our store management team. Panda is 100% committed to the professional and personal development of our family of associates. That’s why we offer paid Store Management Leadership Training, mentorship, and support from our Panda community that cares about your success.

 **What You'll Do As A Store Manager:**


You are in charge of the operation of a single store. This includes, but is not limited to, hiring, managing and directing of associates to achieve financial goals and ensuring the delivery of exceptional guest experiences. It's up to you to make your store a success.


Don’t worry! In order to prepare you for success, we will provide an 8 or more weeks of store leadership training program.

 **How we reward you:**

* Free meals at work while working at Panda
* Generous compensation package with bonus opportunities
* Discounts at theme parks, gym memberships, and much more
* Full medical, dental, and vision insurance\\*\\*
* 401K with company match
* Paid time off and paid holidays\\*\\*
* On-going career and leadership development, including comprehensive training
* Continuous education assistance and scholarships\\*\\*
* Lucrative associate referral bonus
* Income protection including Disability, Life, and AD&D insurance\\*\\*
* Pre-Tax Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account\\*\\*


\\*\\*Candidates must meet, and continue to meet if employed, eligibility requirements for each benefit to qualify.

**Desired Skills & Experience:**

* High school diploma required
* Flexibility to work in a store within a 50-mile radius
* Able to work a flexible schedule, including weekends
* Food Safety: Serve Safe certified

 **ADA Statement:**


While performing duties, counter areas are often hot with steam from steam table and food vapors. Workspace is restricted and employees are generally expected to remain standing for long periods of time. Employees must prepare hot and cold foods, use Chinese cook knife and other kitchen equipment and work quickly without losing accuracy. Employees must be able to lift up to 50 lbs., stand up to four hours and reach across counter tops measured at 36 inches to serve customers. Kitchens are hot and noise levels are usually high; storage space is limited and shelving is high. Employees must be able to work in a fast-paced work environment, have effective verbal communication skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic environment with changing priorities, and the ability to manage conflicts/difficult situations.

 **Panda Strong since 1983:**


Founded in Glendale, California, we are now the largest family-owned American Chinese Restaurant concept in America. With close to 2,300 locations globally, we continue our mission of delivering exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives. Whether it’s impacting our team or the communities we work in, we’re proud to be an organization that embraces family values.

 **You’re wanted here:**


We value diversity in all forms and know the strength it brings. Workplace equality allows for creative ideas to bloom, diverse points of view to be heard, and improves overall happiness. We like the sound of that.


Panda Restaurant Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing equal opportunity, and does not discriminate on the basis of any characteristic protected by law, including but not limited to sex/gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related conditions), gender expression, race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, age, ancestry, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, and veteran status. Additionally, Panda Restaurant Group, Inc. complies with all federal, state, and local laws regarding requests for workplace accommodations. If there is a reason you believe you require an accommodation, please reach out to our accommodation team vie email at PandaLOA@PandaRG.com.
company_description: Panda Restaurant Group, parent company of Panda Inn, Panda Express and Hibachi-San, is dedicated to becoming a world leader in people development.

description:

* Following safety protocols to inspect and clean boilers in order to prevent accidents and injuries
* Conducting regular inspections of boilers to ensure that they are in good working order

* Recording data on fuel usage, system pressure levels, and other factors that could affect safety or efficiency
* Performing routine maintenance on boilers and other equipment used to generate steam or power

title: Best Live-In Ever to work in the Metuchen area
description:
Not many agencies are offering WEEKLY PAY, But Key Home Care does!!!!! We are not the agency call "THE KEY".  

  

Competitive Rate!!!  

  

Come Work for an Agency that really appreciates you!  

  

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide to become a part of our team! You will provide routine healthcare to patients in their home.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst
description:
Ready for a fresh start and a new opportunity? At ABA Life Center, we are looking for experienced, dedicated, top-quality BCBAs and BCaBAs committed to excellence and delivering top-quality services to individuals with autism. Join us for an opportunity to work in a collaborative, positive, ego-free work environment!  

  

**Job Title:** Board-Certified Behavior Analyst or Board-Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst  

  

**Why work at ABA Life Center?**  

* Salary commensurate with experience
* Small caseloads
* Full-time employee benefits package (i.e., 401k, health, dental, vision, etc.)
* Access to continuing education units
* Professional development opportunities
* Opportunity to participate in, conduct, and publish groundbreaking research

  

**ABA Life Center expects our staff to:**  

* Construct and implement a strong and consistent ABA program
* Work in alliance with behavior technicians and parents to develop meaningful and individualized programs
* Provide quality supervision and train staff through BST (e.g., training, modeling, rehearsing, and giving/receiving feedback)
* Be experienced at addressing challenging behaviors (e.g., aggression, elopement, self-injury, etc.)

  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Supervising a team of behavior technicians implementing skill acquisition and behavior reduction programs
* Observing and analyzing skill acquisition/behavior graphs to determine if program modifications are needed
* Conducting a variety of assessments (e.g., VB-MAPP, ABLLS-R, etc.) to guide the direction and determine appropriate goals for clients
* Training parents on skill acquisition and behavior reduction programs
* Creating treatment plans and skill acquisition programs for clients
* Writing thorough progress reports and reauthorization reports
* Regularly monitoring staff and program implementation to ensure high levels of procedural integrity
* Reviewing session notes created by staff to ensure they are comprehensive and in line with company standards

  

***An ideal candidate will have:***  

* Excellent leadership skills
* Strong data analysis skills
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Organization skills
* Time management skills

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Masters Degree (or Bachelor’s Degree for BCaBA)
* BCBA or BCaBA Certification (required)
* Experience supervising RBTs or Behavior Technicians for 2+ years.
* Experience implementing ABA strategies for at least 4+ years.
* Experience working in the home and center setting (preferred)


  

**About ABA Life Center**:  

  

ABA Life Center is striving to reimagine the way ABA services are delivered. We are committed to making genuine connections with our learners and growing alongside them. Our team loves working with individuals with autism and is committed to watching and helping them grow into the best possible versions of themselves. We are looking for staff who are passionate about the field of ABA and who are in this line of work for more than the money–we want people who genuinely want to change the lives of their learners and impact their lives in a positive way.

* High proficiency in relevant tools, Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Dreamweaver, and Google Analytics.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off
* Training & development
  

  

  

***Who We Are***  

Elevated Kids is a BCBA-owned company and a premier ABA/NDBI provider in the Greater Tri-state area that specializes in a naturalistic, developmental approach to Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) for toddlers and young children diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). This evidence-based approach to ABA is called Naturalistic Developmental Behavioral Intervention (NDBI) and is considered best practice for young children diagnosed with Autism. Elevated Kids is driven by compassion, integrity, and a strong commitment that each child and family deserve the absolute best care.  

  

***What We Do***  

Elevated Kids is a family-focused, collaborative team of professionals specializing in the most effective developmental and behavioral supports available for toddlers and young children diagnosed with Autism. Research shows that the best practice for ABA therapy with young children is therapy designed to be implemented in the child's natural setting and consisting of targeting developmentally-appropriate skills with a strong component of parent coaching and family involvement. At Elevated Kids, all early intervention supports are provided in the child's natural environment setting (including home and preschool) and individualized to meet the specific needs of each child and family.  

  

***Job Description***  

We are seeking a creative BCBA who is passionate about early childhood development and teaching through play! The ideal candidate will have experience in early childhood development, developmental delays, ABA, and Autism and ready to join our expanding team in providing each child and family with the highest quality and most effective care available. This is a unique opportunity to join an experienced and rapidly growing team on the forefront of best practice intervention in the world of early Autism care today!  

*General Responsibilities** Implement, develop, and and monitor ABA/NDBI care goals in accordance with each child's individualized treatment plan
* Supervise ABA/NDBI therapy with child and family to address individualized, child-centered goals in the child’s natural environment setting
* Provide parent/teacher coaching and support; implement/model NDBI strategies and therapy techniques with parents/teachers during child’s everyday routines
* Conduct appropriate standardized and developmental assessments (i.e., Vineland-3, ABAS-3, SRS-2, ESDM Checklist, Social Communication Checklist, Functional Behavior Assessment, etc.)
* Develop, implement, and monitor positive behavior support plan and strategies as needed for family and/or school
* Collaborate with teachers and/or other caregivers and professionals
* Provide direct ongoing supervision, coaching, and support to bachelor and Master's level Behavior Therapists
* Aggregate and analyze appropriate data to make data-based decisions
* Prepare and present progress data in comprehensive progress report
* Adhere to all BACB standards

*Qualifications and Skills** Master's Degree in Education, Child Development, Psychology, or a related field
* Board Certification in Behavior Analysis (BCBA)
* Minimum of 1 year preferred working in a supervisory role with families and Behavior Therapists/RBTs
* Minimum of 2 years preferred working with young children (ages 0-8) diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
* Background knowledge and experience in child development and developmental delays
* Experience working with toddlers demonstrating delays in development or diagnosis of ASD is a plus
* Experience implementing NDBI in practice (i.e., ESDM, G-ESDM, JASPER, Project ImPACT) is a plus
* Prioritizes child-led and compassionate approach to care
* Possesses excellent leadership, organizational, and communication skills
* Passion to implement high quality, effective, child-centered intervention with toddlers and young children diagnosed with ASD

*Benefits** Self-employed contractor position
* Flexible Hybrid Schedule
* Highly competitive pay
* Provider Incentive Program (PIP)
* Individualized Health Insurance Plan
* Annual Bonus
* Ongoing training and support in best practice NDBI
* Paid Professional Development opportunities
* Research opportunities
* 401(k) Retirement plan
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program

Schedule:* Daytime Hours
* After School Hours (3pm-7pm)
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:  

* Bonus pay


Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract  

  

Salary: $100.00 - $115.00 per hour  

  

COVID-19 considerations:  

  

Elevated Kids adheres to all CDC guidelines.  

  

Work Location: On the road  

  

**Join our community on Social Media for more Information.**  

  

Website: www.elevatedkids.com  

LinkedIn: Elevated Kids  

Twitter: @elevated\\_kids  

Instagram: @elevated\\_kids  

Facebook: @elevatedkids

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst BCBA
description:
Strategic Therapy Autism Services provides Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services for children on the autism spectrum. Strategic Therapy Autism Services serves clients across the state of New Jersey. We offer strategic ABA treatments, innovative techniques, and compassionate care.  

  

We are seeking Board Certified Behavior Analysts to plan, develop, and monitor behavioral support for clients diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder and/or other behavioral, social and communication challenges. The BCBA will design, implement and evaluate different environmental modifications to produce socially significant improvement in behavior. He/She will be responsible for overseeing individual treatment plans, RBTs , and all other needs of the client(s).  

  

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:  

  

* Conduct descriptive and systematic behavioral assessments, including functional analyses
* Design and supervise ethical and effective behavior analytic interventions
* Develop and implement appropriate assessments, skill acquisition programs and intervention methods
* Use applied behavior analysis to develop behaviors and teach new skills including but not limited to, improving social interactions, on task behaviors, maintain behaviors (self-control and self-monitoring) and transfer behaviors from one situation to another.
* Implement interventions that target behaviors that are essential to the client.
* Function in a supervisory capacity and provide oversight to all areas of programming including the training of behavioral technicians.
* Review and sign off on behavior plan/treatment plan for all field staff.
* Provide support during family conversations regarding assessment results, next steps and recommendations.

QUALIFICATIONS:  

  

* Master’s degree in behavioral analysis, education, psychology or related field.
* Current BCBA and license in the state in which services are being provided.
* 1-year experience preferred.
* Familiarity and ability to administer and interpret variety of clinical assessments.
* Display excellent clinical competence and judgement.
* Demonstrate skills and experience with applied behavioral analysis with children with Autism Spectrum Disorder or related disorders.
* Strong communication, problem-solving, project management, and organizational skills required.

WHAT WE OFFER:  

  

* Immediate Part-time positions to full-time positions
* Flexible Hours - Day/Afternoon/Evenings/Weekends
* Competitive Salary
* Advanced web-based data collection site

Website: www.strategictherapy.com  

  

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

title: Boating Support Specialist
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k) matching
* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance
* Free uniforms
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Training & development
* Vision insurance

  

Are you deeply enthusiastic about boating and looking for a rewarding career working on the water? Do you enjoy working with people and solving problems? Do you have excellent communication and organizational skills? If so, you might be the ideal addition to our team!  

  

Bridge Marina, located on beautiful Lake Hopatcong (and Sandy Hook, NJ), is on the lookout for a dedicated team member for our "Boating Support Specialist" position in Lake Hopatcong. Our team is comprised of enthusiastic and welcoming individuals who are passionate about providing safe and enjoyable experiences on the water. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional boating experiences to our valued guests and boaters.  

  

As the Boating Support Specialist, you will play a vital role in ensuring our guests have a fantastic time on the water. Your responsibilities will extend across various departments, including Sales, Service, Operations and Administration. We are looking for someone seeking a dynamic and versatile role that enjoys both customer-facing and administrative skills.  

  

Key duties include:  

  

* Guest Engagement: Greeting and assisting guests in person, as well as through email, phone, or text in effort to advance guest relationships and development. Assisting with guest satisfaction projects.
* Team Collaboration: Working closely with colleagues in Sales, Service, and Operations to deliver top-notch services and support to our guests.
* Sales Support: Assisting with guest development, communication, and customer service projects and administrative support of sales contracts and support documents.
* Service Support: assisting with communication to service guests, including light technical communication, administrative support of contracts, invoicing, and documentation. Assisting service team or guests with boats, trailers, or vehicles.
* Operations Support: aiding rental, training, club and slip guests with scheduling, questions, directions, as well as supporting administrative tasks of guest documents and or fleet management.
* Management Support: Supporting Managers with various projects, initiatives and or tasks to aid all departments and overall success of company.
* Administrative Oversight: Maintaining organization of the office and reception area, including materials management and paperwork administration. Assisting or managing administrative projects including basic bookkeeping of accounts.

To excel in this role, you should possess the following skills and characteristics:  

* Strong Multitasking and Prioritization Skills: The ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and prioritize them according to their importance and urgency.
* Accountability and Teamwork: Being accountable for your tasks and collaborating seamlessly with your colleagues is vital to ensure smooth operations across multiple departments.
* Dynamic Self-Starter with Strong Problem-Solving Skills: Proactive problem-solving and taking initiative are highly valued traits.
* Excellent Communication Skills: Clear and effective communication, both in understanding others' needs and conveying information, is fundamental in supporting various departments and satisfying guest requests.
* Friendly and Courteous Demeanor with Strong Interpersonal Skills: Creating positive interactions with guests and colleagues fosters a healthy work atmosphere and enhances guest experiences.
* Highly Organized with Great Attention to Detail: Maintaining great organization and attention to detail aids in efficient task management and quality control.
* Positive and Supportive Outlook: Optimistic in efforts and natural interest to help all departments for success of guest experience and team success.
* Patience, Empathy, Tenacity, and Self-Awareness: These qualities are valuable for handling various demands and challenging situations.
* Mechanical Awareness and the Ability to Communicate Technical Concepts in Plain Language: While important, these skills are more specific to the role and can be developed with training.
* An Interest in Working on and Around the Water with Boats and Boaters.
* Proficiency and interest in using phones, text, email, and web-based tools (experience with QuickBooks, Office 365, Cytracom is advantageous, we provide training).

Requirements:  

* Solid foundation of boating expereince to ensure comfort around boats and the marina.
* 2 years of customer service experience.
* 2 years of administration experience.
* 1 year of experience with Office 365, QuickBooks, multi-line phone systems, or equivalent.
* A valid and clean automobile driver’s license.
* Ability to pass a pre-employment background check and drug screening.

Bridge Marina core competencies are defining skills and capabilities we seek in every teammate that gives the Bridge Marina team advantages over our competitors.  

* Workplace Safety: Understands the risks that come with the environment and takes the proper and proactive steps necessary to ensure safety.
* Guest Focus: Appreciates our guests, their situations, perceptions, desires and expectations and attends to their needs in effort to build enduring relationships with the highest level of satisfaction.
* Personal Leadership: Takes responsibility for actions, behaviors, and commitments. Seeks to expand own capabilities and strength. Develops and utilizes positive leadership traits to guide the direction of own efforts.
* Dependability: The quality of being trustworthy and reliable.
* Initiative: The ability to assess issues and initiate effective solutions independently.
* Teamwork: A synergistic way of working with others to achieve a shared goal.

This position is located at Lake Hopatcong, NJ. The role is based in an office/retail environment; however, you will find yourself elsewhere in the marina, on boats and docks, and on the water. This position is a full-time year-round position with opportunity for advancement and growth. We provide health care benefits, retirement plan with company contributions, paid vacation, paid sick time, team events, and opportunity for additional rewards and perks such as boating access, winter holiday breaks, and more. The schedule is full time, typically Tuesday-Saturday with occasional weekend, alternate days, or evening hours. Compensation is commensurate with experience. The hourly wage for this role is $18-$22 per hour, or an equivalent annual compensation of $37,000-$46,000 per year plus potential incentives.  

  

*Bridge Marina does more than just boats; it’s a place where people come to learn to boat, to get on the water and to enjoy all the fun, entertainment and exploration boating can offer. We seek teammates who would enjoy working on and around the water, working with boats and boaters, and being around fun and energizing people. Each team member at Bridge Marina brings skills and passion to a fun, challenging and ever-changing environment on the water.*  

  

*Bridge Marina inspires boaters of all abilities to get on the water. You can feel the energy and enthusiasm when you step onto our docks on a sunny summer afternoon. We have a team of diverse hospitality focused people who provide boat service, boat sales, boating club, boat training, boat rentals, slip services and more in Lake Hopatcong and Sandy Hook New Jersey. Our team and company provides one of the most unique and inspiring boating experiences in the industry.*  

  

Learn more about us online at www.bridgemarina.com or on Facebook, Instagram or TikTok @brigemarina. We look forward to connecting with you.

title: Board Certified Behavioral Analyst
description:
Friends of Firefighters is seeking a part-time Board-Certified Behavioral Analyst (BCBA) to contribute to our mission of delivering free mental health and wellness services to the FDNY community. This position will be responsible for providing services to family members of active and retired FDNY first responders. This is an ongoing contract engagement and has a flexible schedule.  

  

**Rate:**  

 $37-45 per hour, dependent upon experience.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Provide clinical learning needs assessments, functional assessments, and generate appropriate goals and objectives.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records, including progress notes and individualized treatment plans, in accordance with Friends of Firefighters policies and procedures.
* Follow all applicable laws and regulations set forth by the State of New York, and all other applicable regulatory bodies.
* Collaborate with other mental health professionals, medical professionals, and social service providers to ensure that clients receive comprehensive and coordinated care.
* Communicate effectively with clients, families, and Friends of Firefighters to provide education, support, and advocacy.
* Adhere to ethical and professional standards of practice.
* Assist with the expansion of child-focused programmatic activities.
* May include other duties as requested by Friends of Firefighters.

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree in behavioral analysis, education, psychology, or a related field
* Certification of BCBA and License of NYS LBA (Licensed Behavior Analyst)
* One year's experience of Applied Behavior Analysis or teaching children with disabilities preferred.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
* Ability to work flexible hours and meet with clients in-person.

  

*The above job description is not intended to be a complete list of responsibilities for the position. Friends of Firefighters reserves the right to modify job duties as necessary to meet business and client needs.*  

  

Friends of Firefighters is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO), and we encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds, including those who may not check all of the traditional boxes, to apply. Your unique lived experiences and perspectives are essential to our mission to be able to serve our clientele with empathy, understanding, and cultural competence.  

We are dedicated to ensuring equal opportunities for all applicants. If you require application assistance or accommodations throughout the application process, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at applications@friendsoffirefighters.org or by contacting the job poster.

description:
