title: General Manager
description:
Excellence. Integrity. Respect. Innovation. If any of these, or ideally, all of these are leadership core values, we strongly encourage you to read on.

**Yost and Campbell**, a top home services organization specializing in HVAC, plumbing, and generators, has proudly served the Westchester County area for over 85 years. They are currently seeking a **General Manager (GM)** who is a culture-focused, sales centric leader, passionate about developing their team and one who has a strong track record in driving the bottom line.

This organization invests in their leaders and trains them to be cross-functional. There’s no “staying in your lane” but rather, a tremendous opportunity to learn multiple sides and aspects of the business. With various partners and managers throughout the country, leaders are also plugged into a network of constant support. This team leverages best practices amongst one another regularly as the culture is supportive and communicative.

The ideal GM candidate is energetic, warm, articulate, proactive, and a mature executive with a keen and broad-based business sense, bottom-line orientation, and the ability to function as a senior strategist.

**What’s in It for You**

* $160,000-$180,000 annual salary.
* Potential of up to an additional $50,000 bonus, plus another longer-term bonus.
* Medical and Dental – employee and family coverage.
* 401(k) - 100% match up to 4%.
* Paid Vacation.
* Life insurance (no cost to employees, company paid).
* Long term disability insurance (no cost to employees, company paid).

**Overall Responsibilities**

The GM will report to the CEO of the overall organization. The President will serve on the corporate leadership team and will manage Yost and Campbell’s operations, sales, marketing, accounting, and human resources departments. Additionally, this person will represent Yost and Campbell to outside parties including the community, customers, vendors, trade & industry associations, etc.

* Work with the CEO on the development of an expanded strategic vision for the business.
* Mentor, develop, and grow team members, while keeping turnover to a minimum.
* Develop, review, and approve the operating plans of the sales and operations teams with a keen interest in implementing internal “best practice” operational processes and targeted business growth initiatives.
* Execute on timely basis strategies, tactics, and actions aimed at achieving aggressive company goals and objectives for revenue growth, profitability, as well as employee and customer satisfaction.
* Working with CEO and CFO on potential tuck-in acquisitions.
* Oversee building up the plumbing service side of the business.
* Responsible for instilling and driving continuous improvement throughout the organization by planning, leading, and facilitating a unified and seamless implementation of the company’s improvement philosophies and model. Where appropriate share best practices with sister organizations.
* Measure, review, and report the business performance, through P & L analysis and KPI updates, to the CEO. Share this information as appropriate with the team.
* Maintain awareness in the development of sound market strategies, monitor industry trends, attend group conferences, and participate in sales calls, and maintain focus on company growth objectives with a goal of achieving a superior position in the industry.
* Recruit, hire, promote, terminate, and transfer sales and operations personnel.
* Provide and ensure adherence to all safety procedures by entire team.
* Ensure team members are attending the available training both internally and externally.
* Create alignment within the divisional strategic plan to support the overall corporate business plan.

**Skills and Qualifications**

* Must have a minimum of **15 years of progressive business experience**. Ideally in the home services industry, but not required.
* Bachelor's degree in business, construction, or related field optional.
* Proven experience in sales to consumers and developing and training sales employees is critical.
* Track record of recruiting, educating, and developing people resources at the level necessary to meet personnel needs of current and forecasted workloads and business initiatives.
* Experience in a blue collar-oriented consumer facing sales and service organization.
* Extensive experience in project and divisional management.
* Management background in process installation work coupled with strong process orientation.
* Knowledge of the Westchester County and surrounding market area - beneficial.
* Ability to lead a team to accomplish desired results through subordinated levels of management.
* Background in working with a high growth company coupled with building and enhancing a business unit and its strategy.
* Experience representing an organization and its culture to parties both inside and outside the organization.
* Ability to oversee project schedules, inventory, and job estimates.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, especially in providing instructions to employees.
* Able to identify business opportunities and define strategic business direction with the division.
* Proven skill in use of financial statements, budgeting, forecasting and human resources planning.
* Develop and sustain an organizational structure which positions the company to deliver products and services in an efficient, productive, and profitable fashion.
* Demonstrated ability to see current trends, predict future impact of these trends on the business and potential solutions and opportunities related to these trends.
* Knowledge of technology related to the industry and experience with Microsoft Office suite of products (i.e., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.).
* Previous experience executing in an environment with both scheduled and unscheduled service demands from customers.
* Expertise in the CRM - **Service Titan** - is an advantage.

**Skills/Attributes**

* Drives Culture: Lead by example. Helps create a culture in alignment with Values, Purpose, Vision, and Mission of Yost and Campbell.
* Mentor/Coaching: Continually mentor and coach those around them.
* Thinking Skills: Capable of sound decision making without all the necessary information.
* Strategic Focus: Focus on long term as well as short term goals of the division and business.
* Results Driven: Always delivers, does not require follow up.
* Develop Talent Pools: Develop and incentivize employees by help to guide careers.
* Change Leadership: Manage the many aspects of change.
* Motivate/Inspire Others: Drive others to a higher level of performance.
* Mindful of Risk & Safety: Always maintain a safe work environment.
* Communication: Communicate well both internally and externally.
* Business Acumen: Has a high level of expertise within the division’s area of performance.
* High degree of humility, having an “ego” is expected; checking the ego at the door is mandatory.
* Emotionally Intelligent: Calm, professional, and consistent demeanor in all circumstances.
* A servant leader with hands-on operational style and strong administrative skills.
* Unquestionable character and integrity.
* An analytical, self-motivated, problem solver, with a strong attention to detail.
* Ability to balance multiple projects and meet necessary deadlines.
* Smart, team player with excellent active listening skills.
* Must be a key member of the company’s senior management team while not losing touch with details and each employee.

At **Yost and Campbell**, the philosophy is that “if you wouldn’t do it at your mother’s house, you definitely don’t do it at your customer’s house” and our ideal candidate is one who will ensure this is never forgotten. By always putting customers first and aiming to exceed expectations, Yost and Campbell remains a leader in the home services industry.

The collaborative, energetic culture is grounded in their core values and commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, growth, and mobility. As an equal opportunity employer, Yost and Campbell offers competitive compensation packages, robust benefits, and professional growth opportunities aimed at helping to improve employees' lives and careers.

Thank you for considering the **GM** position at Yost and Campbell, an equal opportunity employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $185,000.00 - $230,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* Day shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Senior leadership: 10 years (Required)
* Sales management: 10 years (Required)
* Forecasting: 10 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Academic Advisor/Student Success Specialist
description:
Thank you for your interest in working at William Paterson University.
JOB SUMMARY
Reporting to the Director of WP Online Student Support, the Academic Advisor/Student Success Specialist supports online learners as well as integrating and fostering an online environment. She serves as an academic advisor to this population from acceptance to degree completion - providing cohesive services to support students, with respect to advisement, student finance, and academic support. The Academic Advisor/Student Success Specialist is committed to working collaboratively in a diverse, inclusive, and student-centered learning environment.  

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Maintain a substantial caseload of WP Online Undergraduate students from acceptance to graduation.
2. Meet and collaboratively engage with students to advise them on matters pertaining to academic curricula, requirements and majors, and understanding online program policies and processes. Facilitates academic progression toward degree completion.
3. Respond in a timely manner to student questions, emails, and phone calls, with helpful attitude and correct information. Take an active role to resolve student concerns working with students to help them understand how to communicate effectively with faculty members regarding course concerns.
4. Track students’ academic progress and initiate out-reach to those in various categories of academic jeopardy/failure, respond to students’ inquires and make referrals, as needed.
5. Support new students’ onboarding and success services.
6. Collaborate with key Enrollment Management offices to connect and facilitate students’ smooth matriculation as well as acclimation to WP Online - Undergraduate Admissions; Registrar; Financial Aid; and Student Enrollment Services.
7. Attend weekly strategic meetings with School of Continuing and Professional Education staff to resolve student roadblocks, promote student success, and support continual program development.  

8. Remain current with emerging trends specific to online learning and best practices.
9. Represent the office and participate in campus-wide conversations pertaining to online learning and virtual services.
10. Establish and maintain a cooperative as well as collaborative working relationship with University leadership, administrators, faculty and staff.
11. Serve on University committees as required.
12. Assist with tracking WP Online initiatives: longitudinal tracking, outcome reporting, key performance indicators, program effectiveness, and documentation of results through annual and other reporting requirements.
13. Perform other duties as assigned that are appropriate for the position.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university required. Master’s degree preferred.
* Three (3) years of academic advising or related student affairs experience in an educational setting.
* Experience using Banner Student Information System, Microsoft Office and Navigate is preferred.
* Proficient in academic advising, coaching, and mentoring.
* Have excellent interpersonal, presentation, written, and oral communication skills.
* Proven ability to think creatively, work independently and collaboratively within all levels of an organization.
* Must be able to work flexible hours, to include evenings and weekends.


Salary - AFT - Grade 24 $71,400.87 - $110,654
Invitation to apply
Interested candidates will be prompted to: Complete an application and submit a cover letter
Submission of all documents listed is required for consideration.
General questions related to this application process, please contact talent@wpunj.edu

title: Vice President, Content Strategy and Insights
description:
**Job Summary**


What is the opportunity?  

  

The Vice President will be responsible for leading the development of impactful thought leadership programs and content marketing strategies that support the capital markets business globally. This role is a critical part of the Client and Marketing Strategy team and provides a unique opportunity to partner with business leaders in support of RBC Capital Markets’ growth goals, deliver insights to clients that drive competitive differentiation and gain a deeper knowledge of the themes and trends impacting global economies, markets and industries.
  

  

This position will be highly focused on content strategy, planning, development and execution to support business objectives, drive client engagement and articulate the RBC story. The Vice President will report to the Global Head of Content Strategy and Insights and partner closely on business engagement and management of all strategic and operational aspects of the global team. The Vice President will play a central role in content origination and coordination across omni-channel campaigns, including digital and traditional touchpoints, and will collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize the digital experience to ensure it supports the client journey strategy.  

  

The successful candidate will work closely with Corporate Communications, members of the Client and Marketing Strategy Group across regions, and most importantly with business leaders globally, to develop and execute marketing strategies that help position the business for success.  

  

The position can be located in New York or Toronto. Apply to the separate Toronto job application to be considered for that location. This position does not provide visa sponsorship.**Job Description**

**What will you do?**


The successful candidate will be responsible for the following:

* Work closely with the Global Head of Content Strategy and Insights and members of the Client and Marketing Strategy team (Brand, Business Marketing, Conference and Events) to create strategic thought leadership programs and campaigns to support business goals, promote our expertise/capabilities and engage capital markets’ clients globally.
* Lead engagement and collaboration efforts with business partners across Global Investment Banking, Corporate Banking, Global Markets, Sustainable Finance, Research and more on priority projects and initiatives, as well as targeted client marketing initiatives.
* Drive and oversee content marketing strategy, planning, development and execution with members of the Content Strategy and Insights team.
* Manage editorial resources, including agency partners and studio capabilities, to create and deliver exceptional content and digital experiences for clients.
* Partner with Digital and Social Media team to drive editorial/messaging strategy for paid media, develop digital strategies and execute email nurture campaigns that drive engagement with priority capital markets’ client segments.
* Coordinate with the Conference & Events team to drive activation strategies and manage content initiatives for RBC proprietary conferences, industry sponsorships and other key business initiatives.
* Engage regularly with the corporate communications team to ensure alignment on priorities and messaging, partner on major brand initiatives and explore strategic PR opportunities.
* Develop a strong understanding of client consumption behaviors and what makes content more engaging and shareable with target audiences.
* Learn to monitor and interpret key metrics for content marketing campaigns and help identify ways to optimize performance.

**What do you need to succeed?**

**Must-have**

* BA in Marketing, Communications and/or Business-related degree
* 10+ years of work experience in B2B Financial Services Marketing or Management Consulting; prior experience with Capital Markets, Asset Management or Institutional Investor firms preferred.
* Strategic mindset, problem solver with client-focused approach; ability to think creatively and tactically to drive business outcomes; continuous desire to improve, learn, add value.
* Excellent writing and presentation skills, with an ability to generate new ideas and turn them into compelling thought leadership.
* Strong relationship management, project management and interpersonal skills; ability to work well within and across a team with experience driving results and consensus across a large number of stakeholders.
* Navigate effectively ambiguous situations and be resourceful and solutions oriented.
* Highly organized and entrepreneurial, ability to work on multiple projects in a fast-paced corporate environment while maintaining a high attention to detail.
* Analyze and synthesize data to deliver meaningful insights to drive business decision-making.

**What’s in it for you?**

title: Associate - Volcker Compliance Officer
description:
**Job Summary**

**Job Description**

**What is the Opportunity?**


Provide advisory coverage and conduct ongoing monitoring and surveillance of trading and covered fund activities for compliance with the Volcker Rule (the “Rule”) across 140+ desks and 500+ covered fund investments. Provide oversight and management of Volcker Frameworks.

**What will you do?**

* Provide general advisory support to the business and supporting functional groups regarding the interpretation and application of the Volcker rule
* Perform Volcker impact assessments on New Business Activity (NBC/PAR/Supplement Pool)
* Coordinate with the applicable regulators during examinations and inquiries
* Oversight of and engagement within the Volcker change management process
* Assist with the development of internal controls and processes to adhere to the regulatory requirements of the Volcker rule
* Execute compliance monitoring reviews which audit the effectiveness of internal controls as reflected in the Internal Control Framework and conducting fieldwork in line with the Volcker monitoring program
* Examining policies, procedures, and practices and implementing any needed changes
* Drafting compliance monitoring reports and communicate testing objectives, processes, methodologies, and results to senior management, business owners, and relevant control functions
* Acting as primary point of contact for providing advisory support on all RBC covered funds
* Maintain the Capital Markets covered fund policies, procedures, and practices to ensure compliance with the requirements of the Volcker rule;
* Draft and maintain the Capital Markets enterprise and platform level Volcker policies, procedures, and practices to ensure compliance with the requirements of the Volcker rule;
* Developing system generated reports for Senior Management on internal controls and compliance monitoring.
* Management and oversight of the CEO Attestation/Certification process for Covered Trading, Covered Fund and the Control Framework
* Identify, escalate and remediate issues preventing the successful completion of the CEO attestation/sub-certification process;
* Review certifications for completeness and accuracy including certification language; and
* Request, track, and retain completed certifications and follow-up on delinquent or incomplete certifications.

**What do you need to succeed?**

* Minimum 3+ years’ Volcker work experience
* Experience working in an advisory capacity
* Strong compliance knowledge, and a proven ability to maintain strong relationships
* Experience in a rapidly changing and evolving environment, versatile, adaptable, action oriented and results driven.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with senior management and board members.
* JD, SIE and series 7 license preferred

**What’s in it for you?**


We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

* A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
* Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
* Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
* Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
* Opportunities to do challenging work
* Opportunities to build close relationships with clients


The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $80,000 - $135,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs. This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

title: Counsel, International Compliance
description:
Earthjustice is the premier nonprofit environmental law organization. Our team of more than 550 staff — including more than 200 lawyers — wields the power of law and the strength of partnership to protect public health, address environmental injustice, defend and restore magnificent places and irreplaceable ecosystems, and transition our economy to 100% clean energy while working to protect people and the planet from climate change. We partner with thousands of groups, tribes, individuals, and communities to address the environmental crises of our time. We are here because the earth needs a good lawyer.

Founded in 1971, Earthjustice has a distinguished track record of achieving significant, lasting environmental protections. We achieve this by hiring excellent staff who share a passion for justice and a healthy environment. Our headquarters are in San Francisco, with offices in Anchorage, Bozeman, Chicago, Denver, Honolulu, Houston, Juneau, Los Angeles, Miami, New York, Philadelphia, Seattle, Tallahassee, and Washington, D.C.

Earthjustice seeks a Counsel, International Compliance to assist the Office of the General Counsel with legal compliance and management of risk for Earthjustice’s International Program, which works across borders to use U.S., non-U.S., and international law to protect the global environment. Drawing on deep experience in environmental, human rights, and energy law across jurisdictions around the world, and in litigation and regulatory reform, we work with partners in Africa, Asia, Australia, Latin America, and elsewhere to reduce dependence on fossil fuels and advance clean energy, defend biodiversity and the natural world, and protect human health. Several attorneys in the Office of the General Counsel, as well as most International Program team members are currently based in Earthjustice’s office in San Francisco, with others based elsewhere in the United States. We also work with partners in some locations outside the United States.

The Counsel, International Compliance will play a crucial role in ensuring the organization’s risk assessment and legal compliance. This position will report to the General Counsel and will work alongside other members of the General Counsel’s Office. The position will be responsible for providing legal advice and guidance on a wide range of risk and compliance matters, including international legal and ethical compliance, foreign domestic law compliance, data security, data privacy, anti-corruption, external retaliation risks, and labor and employment law.

The individual in this role will also work with the International Program to provide risk assessment analysis, compliance support and guidance, as well as assist with the implementation of training and best practices. The individual must be comfortable working in areas where there is often significant legal and/or regulatory uncertainty.  

Earthjustice is a legal advocacy organization with a particular focus on litigation, so the successful candidate for this position is likely to be an attorney with litigation and international experience outside the United States and/or in international forums.

This position would be based in Earthjustice’s offices in San Francisco, CA, Washington, D.C., or New York, New York working on a hybrid basis and will report to the General Counsel based in San Francisco.
**Responsibilities*** Research and analyze international laws, foreign domestic laws, and regulations applicable to the organization’s activities.
* Provide legal advice and guidance on compliance matters, including international legal and ethical compliance, foreign domestic compliance, data security, data privacy, anti-corruption, and labor and employment law.
* Develop and implement compliance policies, procedures, training, and management programs.
* Oversee the process of partnering on the development, implementation, management, monitoring, and evaluation of risk assessment programs.
* Ensure appropriate risk assessment and mitigation measures are built into key partnerships alongside internal and external stakeholders.
* Conduct compliance audits and assessments to identify and address potential risks.
* Monitor and report on compliance trends and developments.
* Assist in the development and implementation of compliance training for staff.
* Work with the General Counsel in compliance-related investigations, audits, and legal proceedings.
* Collaborate with colleagues in other departments to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
* Work actively with other staff across Earthjustice to ensure collaboration across the organization’s domestic and international work and to ensure strategic alignment of Earthjustice’s advocacy inside and outside the United States.
* Promote an inclusive work environment and model inclusive behaviors.
* Other duties as assigned.
  

**Qualifications*** Attorney with a Juris Doctor (J.D.) or equivalent non-U.S. law degree from an accredited law school, with at least 5 years of litigation or other relevant experience in a non-U.S. country or in international law.
* Understanding of and experience with advocacy and litigation in both common law and civil law frameworks and with the conditions and challenges related to environmental and human rights protection in the Global South.
* Understanding of global threats and risks, and of international tools, forums, and processes that seek to address these.
* Excellent research and analytical skills.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
* Problem solving, risk analysis, and project management skills. Experience working in a non-profit or international environment is preferred.
* Experience working in international and/or cross-cultural settings.
* Commitment to serving the public interest, and a passion for the role of Earthjustice and its mission.
* Demonstrated awareness of and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals from diverse cultures, backgrounds and orientations.
* Ability to contribute to the creation of a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work culture that encourages and celebrates differences.
* Familiarity or experience working with issues related to climate change, fossil fuel extraction and infrastructure, and/or energy policy and law is desirable.
  

The ideal candidate will have experience working with teams outside the United States, along with a preferred professional fluency in at least one language in addition to English.

We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits that are comprehensive and competitive.  

The salary is dependent on location and experience.  

  

**Salary range in San Francisco, CA and New York, NY: $172,500 - $191,700**  

**Salary range in Washington, DC: $164,00 - $182,200**  

  

To Apply:  

  

Interested applicants should submit the following application materials via Jobvite by **October 16th, 2024** to be considered:* Resume
* Cover letter

Please reach out to jobs@earthjustice.org if you are having technical difficulties submitting your application. No phone calls, drop-ins, or hard copies. Earthjustice only accepts resumes submitted for positions that are currently open. Unsolicited resumes or resumes for posted positions that are not submitted via the online application process (where available), will not be reviewed or retained.  

  

*Earthjustice is driven by a passion for justice, partnership and excellence. Our core values lead us to seek a broad range of perspectives and backgrounds to achieve our mission and to maintain an inclusive environment where all staff are valued and respected. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to employment practices that ensure that employees and applicants for employment are given equal opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or any other factor that is not related to the position.*  

  

*For positions located within the City and County of San Francisco: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.*  

  

*For positions located within the City of Los Angeles: We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.*

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
The **Licensed HVAC Technician** is responsible for the maintenance, repair, and installation of HVAC equipment, ductwork, controls, exhaust equipment, and other building equipment in a facility. This includes the ability to troubleshoot HVAC equipment and controls, perform necessary repairs, and maintain HVAC equipment as part of the facility's preventive maintenance program. The Technician must demonstrate professional competence and attention to detail to ensure that all HVAC systems function at optimal levels, promoting a safe and comfortable environment for all building occupants.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Troubleshoot HVAC equipment and controls to identify problems and perform necessary repairs.
* Conduct ongoing maintenance of HVAC equipment as part of the facility's preventive maintenance program.
* Install ductwork, refrigeration piping, air conditioning units, and exhaust equipment.
* Operate, maintain, and log all HVAC and MEP equipment under the direction of the supervisor.
* Respond to tenant service requests and build positive tenant relationships through prompt and courteous responses.
* Carry out preventive maintenance and repairs on HVAC equipment such as plumbing and electrical systems as directed by the supervisor.
* Maintain computerized or manual logs detailing preventive work performed on equipment.
* Assist in inventory management by helping order stock and maintain supplies.
* Respond promptly to emergency situations and client concerns.
* Review tenant and client improvement plans and inspect active construction areas for compliance with building rules and regulations.
* Manage fire alarm and sprinkler systems, coordinating necessary shutdowns and tests with contractors and vendors.
* Inspect buildings, grounds, and equipment for unsafe or malfunctioning conditions and report to management.
* Maintain and operate life safety/fire systems.
* Perform minor repairs on doors, hardware, locks, windows, ceilings, and floors.
* Troubleshoot and make recommendations to improve maintenance operations and implement savings opportunities.
* Comply with all applicable codes, regulations, governmental agency directives, and company policies related to building operations and practice safe work habits.
* Daily communication with property management, engineering staff, security, tenants, and contractors/vendors is essential.
* Perform other related duties as assigned such as snow removal, assisting other tradesmen, and emergency repairs.


**Key Interactions:**


* Engage with all leaders and stakeholders.
* Engage with all employees organizationally as needed.
* Engage with customers and clients.


**Requirements (Knowledge, Abilities, Skills, and Education and/or Experience):**


* Active HVAC License.
* Minimum of five years of experience as an HVAC mechanic in a commercial/industrial facility.
* Familiarity with HVAC and electrical codes.
* Ability to plan and organize work.
* Proficiency in brazing, soldering, and welding.
* Mechanical and electrical aptitude with large tonnage HVAC equipment is required.
* Must be able to change refrigeration compressors, service cooling towers, rebuild or replace large centrifugal pumps, service & repair VAV boxes, troubleshoot and repair energy management controls and programming.
* Must be able to work varying shifts, weekends and holidays as needed


**Preferred Qualifications****:**


* Demonstrates attention to detail.
* Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner.
* Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; shares expertise with others.
* Responds promptly to customer needs; meets commitments.
* Treats people with respect; works with integrity and ethically; upholds organizational values.
* Follows policies and procedures; completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports organization's goals and values.
* Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; looks for ways to improve and promote quality.
* Observes safety and security procedures; reports potentially unsafe conditions.
* Adapts to changes in the work environment; manages competing demands; able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events


**Working Conditions and/or Physical Requirements**

* The role requires the ability to lift up to 50 pounds, climb ladders, work in tight spaces, and perform physical labor related to maintenance and repair.
* The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.
* Possible frequent exposure to moving mechanical parts and risk of electrical shock. Occasional exposure to wet and/or humid conditions; high, precarious places and outside weather conditions.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
* Availability to respond to after-hours emergencies as necessary.

title: Service Excellence Manager I
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
* Achieve and maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction, individually and collectively within the branch. Provides quality customer service through personal contact with customers and prospects in adherence with company policy including, handling customer issues in person or over the phone in researching and resolving issues.
* Build and promote branch identity, drive product sales and promote overall ownership and accountability for improving customer experience and branch success. Create a welcoming atmosphere that ensures continuous client engagement.
* Meets with customers to analyze financial needs and maximize sales opportunities. Offers all bank products and assists with other service needs (account opening - maintenance and processing transactions) for existing and prospective customers. Comprehensive knowledge of all Bank products and services and the ability to discuss and demonstrate with customers.
* Ability to perform all transactions required by a customer and use appropriate technology to provide services most effectively and efficiently. Maintain and balance a cash box. Ability to utilize technology such as Teller Scanning Equipment, Cash Recycling and Cash Dispensing machines and support customers in the use of Coin Machines.
* Act as Vault Teller ensuring adequacy of Branch cash for daily transactions by assisting the branch staff in ordering and shipping currency - coin and controlling - distributing cash to Tellers in prescribed limits.
* Participates and supports CRA initiatives, activities and programs.
* Reviews and approves requests - to include approval to cash large checks, authorizing bank checks or general ledger tickets, and the approval of various reports, paperwork and cash counts.
* Works to meet existing branch performance standards in areas such as controllable operating losses through compliance with established Bank policies and procedures.
* Continues to build proficiency of banking principles and sales
  

techniques by attending internal training, external training, and completion of continuing education courses.
* Collaborates with the Market Manager by providing feedback regarding interviews, hiring, performance appraisals and disciplinary actions for the staff.
* Assists in community events (i.e. Habitat for Humanity) etc. Participates in and supports CRA initiatives, activities and programs.
* Maintains knowledge and compliance with the Bank's Code of Conduct and all policies and procedures.

Operational responsibilities:
* Under the direction of the Market Manager, supervises all operational aspects of the branch functions to ensure satisfactory audit ratings and adherence to compliance requirements.
* Full knowledge of all branch operations encompassing making sound business decisions and including evaluating, honoring and approving all exception items minimizing potential loss to the bank; supervises Operational Risk.
* Ensure the branch complies daily, meeting all Retail Banking Policy and Procedures.
	+ Ensure Staff and Branch is in full proof daily.
	+ Order and/or prepare currency shipments, ensuring cash vault in proof daily and maintained with assigned cash limits.
	+ Maintain and prepare daily, weekly and/or monthly reports.
* Knowledge and review of proper account opening documentation, ensuring proper documentation is collected and maintained to comply with policy and procedure, including the completion of timely site visits.
* Knowledge of KYC (Know Your Customer) and CIP (Customer
  

Identification Program).
	+ Knowledge of wire documentation, with responsibility for obtaining proper documentation and approvals prior to sending a wire.
* Oversees timely submission and accuracy of all Branch Management Operational reports, AML reporting and audits as required, including reconciliation of Branch general ledger accounts and other report inconsistencies, knowledge of Suspicious Activity red flags.
* Represent VNB in dealing with customer complaints, inquiries or problems, including written correspondence; escalate through proper channels where appropriate.
* Complete all Learning - Development classes as required, including annual Learning Management System training.
* Oversees expenses within established budget guidelines (contra, branch expense).
* Ensure branch appearance meets the Bank's standards including correct and complete signage, address building maintenance issues timely.

Sales Requirements:
* Participate in, help develop and organize in-branch sales activities.
* Meet individual in-branch sales goals.
* Build and expand customer relationships to maintain deposit base and grow the branch.

Requirements:
**Required Skills:*** Ability to prioritize, organize and delegate and follow up on assignments.
* Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations.
* Must have excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
* An enthusiastic individual who can listen to customer concerns and offer a unique and innovative solution.
* Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.
* Basic PC skills including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
* Must be self-driven with a positive outlook and can to demonstrate confidence, tact, patience, and diplomacy while dealing with customers.

**Required Experience:**
* High School diploma or GED and minimum of 4 years related Branch Banking experience in sales, operations and staff oversight or successful completion of the Service Excellence Manager training program.
* Bachelor's degree preferred.
* FIS/IBS (Integrated Banking Solutions) preferred.

title: Junior Groomer
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**Your Petco Grooming Career:**


Begin your Petco journey as a Junior Pet Stylist in Grooming!


During this ten-week training period as a Junior Pet Stylist, you will learn fundamental grooming tasks such as brushing, bathing, drying, cutting nails, and more! Gaining hands-on experience with guidance from seasoned groomers, our industry leading program is designed to develop essential grooming skills and set the foundation for your future career with Petco Grooming.


In addition to our commitment to continuous training, development, and career growth, we also offer:

* Competitive base pay
* Medical, dental, vision and more
* 401k and more
* Paid Time Off
* Petco Discounts
* All the supplies & equipment you need, including, brushes, nail trimmers, clippers, blades, shampoo, sprays, tools, etc.
* State of the art equipment, including bathing system, kennels, tables, and dryers

**Purpose:**

The Junior Pet Stylist's primary purpose is to learn how to perform the following services: bathing, drying, brushing, nail trimming, ear cleaning, and gland cleaning, alongside seasoned groomers. In addition to bathing and drying services, the Junior Pet Stylist will assist in the grooming process, prioritizing the comfort, safety, and well-being of the pets in our care and delivering optimal customer services to pet parents. This is an excellent opportunity for those passionate about animals and grooming to start their career in the pet care industry.

**Essential Job Functions:**

The incumbent must be able to consistently perform all the following duties and responsibilities with or without reasonable accommodation.

* Under close supervision of experienced groomers, perform limited grooming services including bathing, drying, nail trimming, brushing, ear cleaning, and gland cleaning according to the pet parents’ instructions and in adherence to company policies and procedures
* Ensure the well-being and safety of every animal in the salon at all times
* Interact professionally and effectively with pet parents, provide optimal customer service, address grooming related inquiries and provide timely resolution
* Maintain a clean and safe grooming area and salon, disinfect and sanitize grooming tools and equipment, perform daily and weekly cleaning duties in the salon and in adherence to Petco hygiene and sanitation policies, other cleaning and maintenance tasks as assigned, including but not limited to cleaning air filters, vents, and drains
* Schedule grooming appointments, manage paperwork, and maintain accurate grooming records
* Learn and adhere to Petco's grooming policies, standards, and guidelines to ensure safety, quality, and consistency in all activities and areas of the grooming business

**Training Program Outline:**

* Weeks 1-3: Learning and On-the-Job Training
	+ Learn dog behavior, pet and self-safety, proper check-in/out procedures, customer service, grooming policies, and begin on-the-job training in bathing and drying techniques
* Weeks 3-10: Performing and Achieving Productivity
	+ Perform bathing and walk-in services while achieving weekly productivity goals

**Education/Experience:**

* 0-1 year of animal related experience, including shelter volunteering or pet sitting, prior grooming salon assistance is preferred
* High-school diploma or GED is preferred, though not required
* Genuine passion for animals and a desire to pursue a career in pet grooming
* Basic understanding of dog breeds, behavior, and common grooming practices
* Capable of handling pets of all sizes and temperaments with care and empathy
* Effective verbal and written communication skills for interactions with pet parents and grooming team members
* Availability to work weekends, evenings, and holidays, as required by the Pet Care Center’s grooming schedule

**Work Environment:**


The majority of job duties are conducted indoors in the grooming salon. Position requires bending, kneeling, lifting (up to 30 pounds, as necessary) and standing for long periods of time. Position may require exposure to heights using a two-step ladder or other support tools, such as vacuums, to perform assigned cleaning and maintenance duties. A large amount of this partner’s time will be spent in direct contact with our pet parents and their dogs, and the remaining time will be with the other salon partners. The work environment can be noisy and wet.


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

title: Stocker / Cashier
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**As an Operations Generalist, you’ll ensure our merchandising and inventory strategies are executed across the Pet Care Center utilizing our Petco processes. You will ensure the efficient and effective operations of the Pet Care Center to meet the needs of the guest and their pet/s. You’ll work the truck, stock shelves, clean the Pet Care Center, work the cash register, and provide an excellent experience for each of our guests. You can excel in this role by exhibiting a passion for the welfare, health, and proper care of animals as well as being a positive partner within the whole Pet Care Center team.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Position Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

title: Vendor Manager, Gas ENG Welding Ctr of Excellence
description:
**Overview**


The Manager of the NDT Contracts Oversight group in the Welding Center of Excellence Engineering section will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) contracts within the organization. This role requires a strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail and a strong understanding of NDT processes and contract management. This is a Supervisory role to oversee the seamless operation and administration of NDT contracts under the Welding Center of Excellence (WCoE). The responsibilities include leading a team to develop strategies for contract management and compliance, including issuing POs, receipting invoices, scheduling work and maintaining OQ compliance. Required to provide leadership to teams and help them improve their skills. Responsible for designing new processes or procedures based on findings from data analysis. The Manager will analyze data to determine patterns and draw conclusions about business operations. Will be responsible for communicating with top management regarding results of analyses and recommendations for action.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** Manage a team and collaborate with Major Projects, Transmission Maintenance and Construction to support field work by ensuring NDT vendors are available when needed.
* Develop and maintain relationships with Supply Chain, NDT vendors and service providers.
* Oversee the issuance of work orders and manage the invoicing and payment process for NDT services.
* Schedule NDT vendors for ongoing projects and ensure timely delivery of services.
* Implement a tracking system for vendor hours and services to ensure accurate billing.
* Maintain compliance with industry regulations by managing NDT certifications (OQ program) and quality plans.
* Identify process automation opportunities using data analytics and technology to provide efficiencies and create data transparency.
* Perform other related tasks and assignments as required.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education/Experience*** Master's Degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field and 3 years' full-time related work experience or
* Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field and 5 years' full-time related work experience.

**Relevant Work Experience*** Must have 2 years of supervisory experience. Required
* Must possess strong proficiency in Microsoft Office. Required
* Must possess work experience in data analytics, and financial management. Required
* Must possess excellent verbal, written, communication and interpersonal skills. Required
* Must have experience with visualization and/or Business Intelligence tools such as Excel, Tableau, Oracle BI and/or Power BI. Required
* Experience with NDT techniques and quality assurance processes. Preferred
* Experience in gas industry or with pipeline projects. Preferred
* Knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements related to NDT services. Preferred

**Skills And Abilities*** Effective negotiation skills
* Demonstrated analytical skills
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint, etc.
* Well organized, detail oriented and flexible to handle multiple assignments
* Ability to work within tight timeframes and meet strict deadlines
* Project Demonstrated project management skills

**Licenses And Certfications*** Driver's License Required

**Physical Demands*** Sit or stand to use a keyboard, mouse, and computer for the duration of the workday
* Ability to read small print and symbols

**Additional Physical Demands*** Must be able to respond to Company emergencies by performing a System Emergency Assignment to restore service to our customers.
* Ability to respond to system emergencies.
* Must be able and willing to travel within Company service territory, as needed.

title: Engineering Supervisor, Regional Engineering - Cust Engineering
description:
**Overview**


Customer Engineering is seeking to recruit an Engineering Supervisor to join it's management team. The successful candidate must be energetic and demonstrate an unwavering commitment to our Code of Conduct and The Way We Work Principles. The candidate must demonstrate a high energy level and promote a positive work ethic and customer service mentality in support of our corporate values and mission. The Engineering Supervisor is responsible for overseeing activities related to Electric New Business requests. This involves supervising a team of designers whom will analyze customer load letter submittals and provide the service determinations and required distribution system reinforcement, if necessary. Review and issue the corresponding layouts and/ or B&A's, if required.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** Ensure implementation of Company safety, health and environmental programs for employees and that safe work practices are followed and the environment is fully protected in accordance with Company policy and governmental regulations.
* Performs safety talks, OJTs and ensures implementation of Company safety, health and environmental programs for subordinates.
* Ensures safe work practices are followed and environmental considerations in accordance with Company policy and governmental regulations are included in service designs.
* Supervise Designers and other subordinate titled personnel in the design, reinforcement and expansion of the electrical distribution systems for new business projects.
* Provide instruction and guidance in the development of service determination and construction layouts.
* Enforces good housekeeping practices and ensures that subordinates work activities are performed in a safe and efficient manner, and in accordance with established policies and procedures.
* Reviews progress of various projects to ensure their completion in a timely and professional manner.
* Plans, organizes, schedules and assigns work activities to personnel to meet operating needs, customer service requirements and departmental goals.
* Ensures that technical and customer excellence are the highest priorities when developing methods of supplying new or additional loads.
* Responsible for the on-going evaluation of employee performance to ensure: adherence to Company design specifications/guidelines meets and/or exceeds productivity expectations.
* Assess training needs and take corrective actions as may be required.
* Provides individual and supervisory engineering support during distribution system contingency.
* Ensures that the plans and drawings for the service design, including reinforcement, expansion and maintenances of the electrical distribution system are prepared in compliance with operating procedures, engineering specifications and Company policies.
* Certifies engineering designs, drawings and field prepared layouts on proposed new business capital projects.
* Promotes consistency in work practice within all of Customer Engineering.
* Represents the Company at meetings with customers, contractors, governmental officials, consulting engineers, lawyers and other Company personnel regarding electric service and distribution, method of supply and feasibility to ensure compliance with Company procedures and specifications.
* Reviews high-tension specifications and customer operating procedures for proposed high-tension services to ensure compliance with Company Operating Procedures, engineering plans and Company specifications.
* Develops a full understanding of the Company Rate Schedule applicable to installation and maintenance of electric facilities and ensures compliance on service determinations.
* Supervises the preparation of necessary documents and technical data required to process major projects for Work Order Approval. Assists Customer Engineering Manager in the preparation of Capital Budget.
* Ensures compliance with collective bargaining contract and participates in Union negotiations at the first line level.
* Perform other related tasks and assignments as required.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education/Experience*** Bachelor's Degree and 2 years of relevant work experience (Engineering degree preferred)

**Relevant Work Experience*** Must have at least (2) years' experience with engineering related projects. Required
* Must be detail oriented and have excellent organizational, analytical and technical skills. Required
* Must possess strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to diplomatically interact with internal and external customers, support staff and various levels of management. Required
* Supervisory experience. Preferred
* Understanding of various computer systems and software applications, including Work Management System, Logica, Load Aggregator and MS Office products. Preferred
* Must have an understanding of Electric Operations specifications and procedures, engineering layouts, feeder prints, M&S and C&DO plates. Preferred
* Knowledge of Electric Operations, which includes equipment, cable and splicing. associated with underground and/ or overhead installation and associated construction standards. Preferred
* Experience with distribution electrical equipment. Preferred

**Skills And Abilities*** Possesses strong technical aptitude
* Demonstrated time management and priority setting skills
* Well organized, detail oriented and flexible to handle multiple assignments
* Demonstrates excellent judgment and decision making skills
* Effective leadership skills
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Demonstrated analytical skills
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint, etc.

**Licenses And Certfications*** Driver's License Required

**Additional Physical Demands*** Must be able to respond to Company emergencies by performing a System Emergency Assignment to restore service to our customers.
* Must be able and willing to travel within Company service territory, as needed.
* Walking, climbing driving and site visits are required.

title: Section Manager, OR Subst & Trans Engineering
description:
**Overview**


Under general supervision of the Chief Transmission & Substation Engineer, perform Substation Electrical Engineering and Design with key considerations for substation design including physical layouts, major substation equipment, protection and control systems.Supervise assigned Project/Substation Engineers and provide an oversite for all new substation and upgrade projects. Provide technical guidance, training and expertise to less experienced engineering staff. Provide leadership in the form of directing the engineering duties using the individual's experience and judgment. Make independent decisions and recommendations on engineering issues. Provide engineering support and expertise for various operations groups throughout the Company. Attend and represent the Company at industry meetings and serve on committees as required.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** Supervise and Coordinate Engineers and Designers in day-to-day tasks to support substation layout designs including plans, sections and details, grounding, lightning protection, control building arrangements, interior and exterior raceways, auxiliary AC/DC power systems, and associated bill of material.
* Participate in substation design at all stages of project development, including concept, pre-feasibility, feasibility, detail design, procurement, and construction. Review/supervise calculations, drawings, specifications, and perform condition assessments and feasibility studies.
* Accountable for design in accordance with all applicable codes and standards (e.g. IEEE, EEI, ANSI, etc.)
* Develop engineering/technical specifications and coordinate design activities to maintain project schedules and ensure successful project completion.
* Directs the development of the Substation & Transmission Operations capital budget, monitors performance against the budget, adjusts the budget as necessary and determines and presents the monthly living budget adjustments and projections to the Chief Engineer.
* Support the development of project schedule and cost estimates.
* Coordinate design activities with other engineering disciplines to maintain project schedules and ensure successful project completion. Work closely with design consultants, contractors, and manufacturers to support the needs of the project.
* Work closely with Substation Operations and System Operations to coordinate the construction, commission and testing activities, and outage requirement/planning.
* Supervises the preparation specifications for all engineering tasks, construction, commission and testing activities. Work closely with manufacturers, contractors, and suppliers relative to their proposals, project performance, specification of materials, processing of invoices for payment in accordance with their performance under contract. Keep informed of industry developments and keeps up to date with the latest developments in the substation equipment and design engineering field.
* Supports the Departments regulatory compliance efforts and reporting. Directs the departments activities in engineering efforts for FERC, NERC, NPCC, and RFC compliance. Coordinates preparation and participates in CEO Certification, Spot Checks, Periodic Data Submittals, on site and off-site audits.
* Reviews and approves drawings and submittals to Municipal agencies as required. Testifies as an expert for the Company in Municipal Hearings where required.
* Provides assistance during Company storms or other system emergency events and functions as necessary.
* Directs the preparation of testimony and exhibits for O&R and RECO rate cases and required filings.
* Aligns with corporate strategy regarding diversity and inclusion efforts in recruitment and selection and promotes a workplace culture where every voice is welcome, heard, and respected.
* Facilitates employee development. Reinforces and documents positive feedback for examples of work excellence and dedication, and ensures timely discipline is administered as appropriate. Completes performance review and manages the training process for employee.
* Performs other related assignments, as required.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education/Experience*** Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering and 8 years of relevant work experience of relevant work experience or
* Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering and 6 years of relevant work experience of relevant work experience

**Preferred Education/Experience*** Master's Degree in Engineering, Electric Engineering preferred. and The attainment of or working towards an advanced technical degree is preferred.

**Relevant Work Experience*** Must have a minimum of 8-10 years experience in the planning, design, and operation of electric substation and transmission systems. Required
* Well organized, detail oriented and flexible to handle multiple assignments and deadlines. Required
* Prior supervisory experience is required. Required
* Working knowledge of capital and O&M projects / budgets and requisite planning processes to meet established budget constraints. Required
* Technically proficient in a broad range of engineering responsibilities and show a willingness to explore and implement new and creative solutions. Required
* Knowledge of regulations pertaining to Utility Substation design. Required
* Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to train and supervise other employees effectively. Required
* Demonstrate a high energy level, be flexible, and be able to handle multiple assignments while meeting deadlines. Required
* Possess proven leadership qualities/skills including strong decision-making, organizational and interpersonal, oral and written communication, analytical and administrative skills. Continuing ability to implement with a solid teamwork orientation and strong attention to detail are essential. Required
* Articulate, have a professional demeanor and be comfortable dealing with all levels of stakeholders, including internal and external customers and regulators. Required
* Knowledge of major substation equipment, protective relay system, and SCADA system. Required

**Licenses And Certfications*** Driver's License Required
* Professional Engineer (PE) Must be working toward securing a Professional Engineer's License in NY or NJ if a license is not held in that state. Required

**Additional Physical Demands*** Must be able to respond to Company emergencies by performing a System Emergency Assignment to restore service to our customers.
* Must be able and willing to travel within O&R and CECONY service territory, as needed.

title: E2E Data & Applied AI Lead Analyst
description:
Description  

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:


**E2E Data & Applied AI Lead Analyst**This position reports into the Senior R and D Product Manager and will be located at Skillman, NJ.


**Who we are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.


**Role reports to:** Senior R and D Product Manager


**Location:** Skillman, NJ Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is currently located in Skillman NJ, but is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025.
**Travel %:** 10%
**Pay**: $92,000 - $149,500  


**What you will do**


As E2E Data & Applied AI Lead Analyst, you will leverage the power of data and technology to create new solutions and lead transformational change across the E2E value chain. You and your team will work closely with key technology and business partners to apply human-centered design techniques to empathize with users and help design intelligent solutions that delight them. You will collaborate with the business to execute experiments with users to validate and further refine those problems and solutions. You will engage skilled resources to incubate the solution Minimum Viable Product and, when successful, continue to scale, launch, and enhance that solution to drive higher levels of community engagement and participation.



For existing E2E solutions, you will play the Technical Application Owner and work with Product and Process Owners to continually evaluate and co-create product roadmaps. You will partner with other technical teams internally and externally, ensuring the integration and alignment of key product roadmap capabilities, while also addressing critical technical lifecycle management and key compliance activities. You will employ Agile best-practices to accelerate speed and deliver solutions across the organization.


We seek co-workers with a B.S. or equivalent with a minimum of 5 years of related technology experience. We expect experience in analysis, strategic assessment, project management, and GxP compliance activities. We support unique and independent thought and creativity, combined with pragmatic analytical rigor - with the ability to cultivate meaningful insights that inspire and inform our technical solutions.



If you are you looking for a dynamic and creative technology role helping people live more healthy and vibrant lives as part of Kenvue, this may be the career opportunity to help make it happen.

  



Responsibilities:



We are a customer centric and integrated team. You will develop a keen understanding of E2E product development processes and data flow. You will partner closely with business technology leaders and internal and external technology partners to build and support innovative product solutions for the Artwork capability at Kenvue.


We love data. You will identify opportunities to drive continual improvement, leveraging both new and existing metrics. We also work in a GxP compliant environment. You will ensure that Kenvue information assets are appropriately identified, valued, and protected by complying with and enforcing all local and worldwide security policies.



We are a global team. You will partner with an extended team of both internal and external partners across multiple time-zones to provide technology solutions that delight. You will regularly provide customer-facing communications and demos related to your products, their budgets, and their value delivery to senior leaders from Technology and functional organizations.


Qualifications **What we are looking for**


Required Qualifications
* Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required, with a minimum of 5 years of related business experience required.

  



Experience and Skills


* Consistent record of delivering results. Demonstrated leadership, influencing skills, interdependent partnering skills, as well as critical thinking skills required
* Experience working in an Agile team leveraging SDLC methodology, Risk management including Security is required
* Hands on understanding of Design Principles (User Interface and Business Process) is preferred.
* The ability to synthesize leadership and partner inputs into decisions, to lead projects of medium to high level of complexity, and to be comfortable operating amongst senior R&D partners is required.
* Ability to estimate required effort for project objectives and prioritize work items appropriately.

  



Other:


* Excellent written and oral communication skills, interpersonal skills, strong negotiating skills, and the ability to motivate in a collaborative environment with exceptional service orientation are all requirements.
* Working knowledge of Atlassian tools such as AgileCraft, Jira, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo, Trello is preferred.
* Hands-on focused project management skills are preferred.
* Ability to craft context around key business features and behaviors and present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language.
* Up to 10% domestic / international travel is required for this position

  


**What’s in it for you**


* Competitive Total Rewards Package\\*
* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!
* Learning & Development Opportunities
* Employee Resource Groups

  


* Note: Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.

  



Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

  




#vdh

  


Primary Location NA-US-New Jersey-Skillman
Job Function Info Technology
